programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Russia spans over six million square miles of some of the most rugged terrain on Earth, much of which is uninhabited and largely unexplored. It is also the home of cosmism - a belief that human civilization originated in the cosmos.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Chase goes after the biggest gator he has ever seen, Daniel gets under Dwaine's skin, and Kristi clears invading gators off her homestead.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: As the fleet enters the final six weeks of the fishing season, some of the captains take big risks by changing their tactics and techniques to ensure they maximise their catches.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The end of the tuna season is in sight, putting the captains under great pressure. It seems that now, only those who keep a level head will succeed.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a medal with links to Captain Cook, and a putter from the famed 1963 Frank Sinatra Invitational. Plus, Rick's stress levels hit a new high.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff examine items signed by President Franklin D Roosevelt, as well as a rare photograph taken during baseball star Babe Ruth's debut season.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit a cemetery in Texas said to contain the body of an alien who crash-landed on Earth in 1897.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine an ancient Hindi scripture about a giant flying creature landing on Earth, and consider if this could be a description of an alien spacecraft.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Wildfires ravage California, a tornado terrorises people trapped in a gas station, daredevils skydive over Antarctica, and a microburst causes chaos.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Chase goes after the biggest gator he has ever seen, Daniel gets under Dwaine's skin, and Kristi clears invading gators off her homestead.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Steve takes on the challenge of restoring a rusty 1978 Gran Torino to its former glory.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor tell the stories behind artefacts unearthed from former military sites across the UK. They also discover a tank buried in a vineyard.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor go in search of relics from the United States' elite 82nd airborne infantry division.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An LA auction brings more competition than the buyers were expecting, and Dave Hester returns despite his chequered history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy finds a way to lighten the mood in the hot California sun, but the bidding wars that ensue are anything but cool.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Santa Ana, California, where an inexpensive-looking locker could lead to a huge payout for one team.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell fights off competition as he tries to secure a locker worth $27,000, and Dave bids for a unit with a stockpile of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave has his eye on an electronics locker, and Darrell uncovers a classic movie prop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry asks a member of rock band Aerosmith for a valuation, and Dave discovers an antique toy.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave comes to blows with his estranged brother over rock memorabilia, and Barry discovers a valuable piece of modern art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A mystery bidder begins to dominate the competition, pushing Dave to the limit.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked with creating a signature Damascus blade out of three different steels of different thicknesses. The two final competitors re-create one of the most intricate weapons in history - the steel crossbow..

programme.title: Ozzy & Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Father-and-son duo Ozzy and Jack Osbourne head to Japan in search of a samurai master, and on the way try their hand at forging a sword.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.sub-title: A Photo a Tooth the Truth?
programme.desc: Two potentially game-changing discoveries are made in the Ozarks as the investigation into whether giant humanoids ever roamed America continues.

programme.title: Barbarians Rising
programme.desc: The rise and fall of the Roman Empire from the perspective of the rebel tribes that brought the Empire to its knees, beginning with the story of Hannibal of Carthage, who built the first great barbarian alliance to defeat Rome before it became unstoppable.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Wildfires ravage California, a tornado terrorises people trapped in a gas station, daredevils skydive over Antarctica, and a microburst causes chaos.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Examining the San Bernardino train disaster, when a freight train derailed and crashed into a row of houses in a residential area - before causing the rupture of a gas pipe.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedy writer and actor Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Conservative MP Nicky Morgan and comedian Jon Richardson joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian performs another round of witty stand-up shows, beginning as he gets involved in shredding some naughty magazines, helps a gerbil to fulfil its destiny, and is surprised by the pictures that develop from an old-fashioned camera he finds.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Annie Siddons, Patrick Kielty, Katherine Ryan and Joe Lycett to muse on parking tickets and plane crashes.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Melanie C, Jamali Maddix, Jessica Knappett and Ardal O'Hanlon.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part programme, the naturalist travels down the Baliem River's lower gorge, one of the most dangerous stretches of white water in the world surrounded by jagged rock walls. His exploration of the surrounding jungle leads to an encounter with a tribe that has had little contact with the outside world. As he concludes his trek in the river's coastal reaches, he faces a crisis of conscience as he witnesses a traditional crocodile hunt.

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: A 16-course taster menu is the pinnacle of Nick Helm's culinary pilgrimage to Leeds, where he meets his food hero, chef Michael O'Hare.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick enjoys some American pancakes and goes veggie with Thunder's Luke Morley.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More than 100 boxes full of drugs are discovered inside an unlikely vehicle at the World Trade Bridge. In Progreso, a suspected gang member attempts to cross into the United States.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Border Patrol Agents along the legendary Rio Grande hunt down Mexican drug smugglers who are moving large stashes across the border.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Custom and Border Protection in Nogales, Arizona, look to intercept drugs even as cartels have become better than ever at hiding them in vehicles.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: In California, Brandon and Lori are given a surprise in one of their storage unit lots.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori discover a dead cow in one of their storage unit lots.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon wins some spy equipment at an auction in Culver City.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse forges controversial alliances, while Sean uncovers an auction lot that has been used for a prank.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: TV presenter Claudia Winkleman, broadcaster Clive Anderson, comedian Jason Manford and comedienne Miranda Hart join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jack Whitehall and Frankie Boyle, TV presenter Christine Bleakley and journalist Kelvin MacKenzie join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Dave Gorman and Omid Djalili, TV presenter Davina McCall and journalist Janet Street-Porter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness and Freddie Flintoff go on a jungle adventure in Borneo with the Gurkhas, in a pair of rare but very cheap old cars. Back in the studio, Chris Harris gets behind the wheel of the world's most luxurious SUV, and the gang is joined by Bob Mortimer.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist ventures into uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries. He takes on physical challenges, encounters extraordinary wildlife and meets remarkable people. In the first edition, Steve and a team of climbers and jungle survival experts head into the ancient landscape of South America's Guiana Shield. This vast wilderness of pristine forests and towering table-top mountains is one of the most inaccessible terrains on the planet.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedy writer and actor Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Conservative MP Nicky Morgan and comedian Jon Richardson joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with comedians Phill Jupitus, Josh Widdicombe and Sara Pascoe joining regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the topic of monsters.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Dee, Seann Walsh and Milton Jones
programme.desc: Jack Dee hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by observational comedian Seann Walsh and king of the one-liners Milton Jones.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer is taken prisoner on a planet where the inhabitants and landscape are created by his own mind and is subjected to a series of gruesome tortures devised by his imagination, leaving the rest of the crew to come up with a way to rescue him. Starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Stand-up and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Grace Dent and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: A marine biologist and a deep-sea diver explore Chuuk Lagoon, one of the world's greatest underwater graveyards, for a wreck discovered by sonar nearly 20 years ago.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The forgery of Hitler's diaries in the 1980s, which fooled several respected historians and news publications, and brought to light the thriving trade in Nazi memorabilia.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The story of Orson Welles' infamous radio adaptation of HG Wells' The War of the Worlds, which many Americans mistook for a news broadcast about a real alien invasion.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: Series examining the making of the ever-popular prison sitcom, featuring contributions from cast members, writers and fans.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General von Klinkerhoffen visits the vineyard where Rene and the Resistance are working, and jeopardises their scheme to return the British airmen home.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: Pretty Maids All in a Row
programme.desc: Rene conceals the painting of the Fallen Madonna, while the British airmen make another escape attempt, smuggling themselves into a PoW camp and faking their own deaths. However, the plan is jeopardised by the Gestapo, who suspect they are hiding in the cafe. Second World War comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and the gang are roped into helping dig a tunnel from the mortuary to the PoW quarters, but end up trapped inside the camp - disguised as British inmates - when their hard work collapses behind them. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Bomber learns his daughter has run away, and immediately flies home to lend his wife moral support - unaware the young lady in question is winging her way to Dusseldorf to be with him. Comedy drama, starring Pat Roach, Tim Healy, Gary Holton and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Brenda makes it clear that she thinks Neville is living it up in Germany just as a leather-clad local girl, whom he merely shared a taxi with, accuses him of assaulting her. Cult comedy drama, starring Kevin Whately, Tim Healy and Julia Tobin.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Discovering the eerie wasteland of failed planets and strange rocks that lies beyond Mars and before Jupiter.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: I Am the Night
programme.desc: A teenage girl and a disgraced journalist find themselves drawn into a web of secrets revolving around 1940s Los Angeles' most infamous cold case. Fauna Hodel (India Eisley), a naïve young girl growing up near Reno, Nevada, embarks on a desperate quest to discover who she is. In Los Angeles, Jay Singletary (Chris Pine), a former Marine turned hack reporter covers a gruesome murder.

programme.title: I Am the Night
programme.desc: Fauna arrives in Los Angeles and tries to track down members of her family. She goes to the Hodel residence and meets Corinna Hodel who takes her out for the day. Meanwhile, Jay continues to work on a story involving a gruesome murder, but is still fixated on his earlier story involving the doctor George Hodel and Fauna. Chris Pine stars.

programme.title: I Am the Night
programme.desc: A visit from Billis and the LAPD leaves Jay wondering how close he's getting to the truth. Fauna must reconcile Corinna's revelations with the suspicion that Corinna is hiding Fauna's mother, Tamar.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An armed robbery case leads Phil Hunter and Jo Masters to the door of petty criminal Gareth Dickson, who is making and selling firearms so shoddy they are a danger to the user - as his eight-year-old nephew seems keen to prove. Gina Gold gets a warm welcome back at Sun Hill, but for Sheelagh Murphy the return to work following the death of fiance David Kent brings a crisis of confidence and a confession she's thinking of resigning.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh Murphy announces she's transferring to the Child Protection Unit at Croydon and Roger Valentine has temptation put in his way by bent copper Harry Haynes, the man he's investigating. As the coroner's hearing into the death of David Kent approaches, June Ackland nervously prepares to meet her long-lost son Gabriel, and a barrage of questions about his father forces her to reveal the circumstances under which she became pregnant.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Moth
programme.desc: Feature-length version of the drama set at the turn of the 20th century, about the fortunes of a carpenter who moves to the country to start work in his uncle's furniture business, but finds himself forced to seek employment with a beguiling woman known locally as the Moth. Jack Davenport and Justine Waddell star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Inverness is shocked by the death of a teacher whose fiance is serving overseas, and Elizabeth realises Henry's relationship with her grandson is not just professional.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah confronts Regina about her suspicions regarding the death of Milly Davis, but Regina calls her bluff and informs Sergeant Taylor, while Jack asks Carolyn to marry him.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth discovers Emmet has planned a piano concert for the senior citizens at the church hall, and decides to treat the lucky audience to her own brand of sing-song. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and David Griffin.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Daddy dresses up in a spaceman suit and goes on the rampage in the toy department of a local shop, forcing an embarrassed Hyacinth to intervene. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: As Harrow and Grace investigate the death of a popular health and wellness vlogger, Harrow agitates for the exhumation of Chester's remains. Australian drama, with Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The news of his grandmother's death sends Pascoe into mourning, and while sorting her belongings, he discovers his grandfather may have been a First World War deserter. Unable to accept this, he resolves to uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Wield and Dalziel investigate a raid by animal rights activists on a pharmaceutical company. Starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Frances Barber, Shaun Dooley and Jimmy Reddington.

programme.title: I Am the Night
programme.desc: A phone call in the middle of the night from Corinna has Jay believing that there are cracks appearing in the Hodel case. He's also under the impression that the Bloody Romeo case may have something to do with the famed Black Dahlia murders.

programme.title: Super 4

programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Kids' documentary series looking at what it takes to become a professional at all kinds of exciting jobs. Agent Danny is back at school, but this time he's the teacher..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is babysitting the Neighbours' toddler. The baby flees and kidnaps Fizz mistaking him for a plush toy..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has invented a machine which stops toast from landing butter-side down. Magoo sees some floating toast and believes a ghost is haunting their house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is on a beach and that sailors are emptying their oil tanker right into the ocean..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, Iris and the turtles are playing a game of ping pong when a mysterious aged turtle arrives on the patio and gets hit by the ball..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons find a brilliant way of getting into the Mikkelsen's's house without anyone noticing by getting mailed to the house inside in a cardboard box.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Faced with a long shopping list from his formidable landlady, the hapless half-wit builds a giant motorised trolley from a petrol mower and pram wheels, hoping to get the job done in double-quick time.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben instead sets his sights on a Sumo Slammer collectible.

programme.title: Martin & Roman's Sunday Best!
programme.desc: Martin and Roman Kemp team up to present this entertainment show featuring celebrity chat, music and comedy, as well as a series of fun challenges to find out whether father or son will come out on top. Their first guests are Ricky Wilson, Ade Adepitan and Anne Hegerty.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James visits the Shetland Islands, an area of natural beauty that he's always wanted to see. He gets to hire a vintage car to explore the area, where he learns about traditional fish salting and cooks a tasty vegetable curry at a local social enterprise project. Later on, James learns all about Shetland community spirit and cake at one of their famous Sunday teas, and finally cooks up a Shetland-inspired paella on a beautiful local beach.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner prepare a fish chowder served in a bread bowl, followed by handmade pasta with only three ingredients, and French toast berry muffins for dessert.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head to Hull to transform the garden of a 90-year-old land girl and ballroom dancing devotee. Frailty has seen the twice-widowed great-grandmother lose the ability to tend her once beautiful gardens, so they have become neglected no-go areas. After Alan surprises her at a tea dance, the team transforms her gardens into spaces she can safely tend to again.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Filmed by his wife Alison, Alan shares the secrets to creating a picture-perfect lettuce patch, even when space is tight, and there are tips and advice from the rest of the Love Your Garden team from their own gardens across the country. Frances Tophill adds flowers with pest-fighting power to her tiny vegetable plot, Katie Rushworth shows how to construct a vertical garden that will suit any budget and David Domoney looks ahead to autumn and demonstrates how to make a sweetcorn and pumpkin patch.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle tries his hand at free diving in Cornwall and Liz Bonnin works with a team of volunteers at Cuan Wildlife Rescue centre in Shropshire caring for injured birds. Lesley Joseph indulges her love of stately homes as she turns guide for the day at Osterley Park in Middlesex and John Whaite travels back home to Lancashire and the family farm he grew up on to cook up some Eccles cakes.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: In a reality TV special, former Gogglebox star and 2016 Queen of the Jungle Scarlett Moffatt takes on 2019 Love Island contestant Curtis Pritchard. The pair - along with their families - go head to head in the knockout tournament, hoping to advance to the next round. Presented by Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: More mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes, while a panel of more famous faces tries to guess their identities. Nick Cannon oversees the contest, as mystery singers dressed as Black Widow, Leopard, Flamingo and Panda take to the stage, while panellists Robin Thicke, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, and regular star of the British spin-off Ken Jeong, try to work out who is behind the mask.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Colwyn Bay, North Wales, where Helen Gardiner finds a diamond ring and Jan Keyne discovers some classic Moorcroft.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a revival of classic game show Take Your Pick. A selection of plucky audience members go up against the gong and play the famous Yes/No game as Alan bombards them with hilarious questions. One lucky player will then make it through to the brand-new epic endgame, and could take home a car. The show also features The Chase's Dark Destroyer, Shaun Wallace.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: TV presenters Fiona Bruce, Rick Edwards, Kate Humble and Joe Swash pit their general knowledge against a trivia expert as they try to win thousands of pounds for charity. However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh hosts.

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, Jyn Erso - the maverick daughter of scientist Galen Erso - joins the Rebel Alliance. On the planet Scarif, she and the freedom fighters, including a blind warrior and a deadpan droid, attempt to steal plans for the Death Star, a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds, which was designed by her father on behalf of the Empire. However, the Rebels face tough competition from Imperial warlord Orson Krennic and shadowy forces, including Darth Vader, who will come to play a major part in the rise of the Empire. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.

programme.title: The London Palladium: The Greatest Stage on Earth
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a documentary about the famous theatre, meeting some of the stars who have trod its boards, discovering the backstage secrets of its history, and uncovering archive footage of classic performances, including a long-lost recording of Morecambe and Wise. Featuring contributions from Stephen Fry, Sheila Hancock, Andrew Lloyd Webber, Beverley Knight and Phillip Schofield.

programme.desc: The 2010's have been a decade of great pop hits! We've dived deep into the collection to bring you some of the best.

programme.title: Rihanna From The Start
programme.desc: See how Rihanna made it into the charts from her earliest hits through to breakthrough singles and taking the world by storm..

programme.title: Vas J Morgan's Pop Transformations
programme.desc: Fashionista and reality star Vas Morgan takes a look at some of the biggest transformations the world of pop has ever seen, from good girl gone bad Miley, to Calvin's inflated pecks.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: George and Scott head back to Ghana, $1million in debt and determined to find gold, but they face a host of pitfalls while trying to get the operation back on track.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson heads to Lake Michigan to investigate an unexplained Bermuda Triangle-like phenomenon that has caused ships to disappear for centuries.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Hollywood star Bill Murray commissions a bike based on his character in the film Caddyshack, to be auctioned at a charity golf competition.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Era Alaska has a special canine delivery for Iditarod champion Lance Mackey. Plus, Jim and Ferno cope with the airline's busiest day of the year.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of less than pleasant tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The techniques involved in making balloons, frozen chips, incandescent light bulbs and wallpaper.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes behind the making of matches, carousel horses, fine porcelain and car fuel tanks.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Grant teaches son Matt the dangerous game of mustering. Elsewhere, Ash takes on 230,000 volts of electricity in a high wire act of precision flying.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne asks a custom coachbuilder to design a one-off hot rod. Meanwhile, Wayne readies the oldest existing DuPont vehicle for the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tries to track down an early SUV - a 1970 International Harvester Scout 800A. Ant's repair includes rebuilding a leaky transfer case and replacing the interior.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole tries to restore a monkey bike, and Simon O'Brien makes use of all his skills as he tries to give new life to an old racing bicycle.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien finds a barn containing a collection of replica Rolls-Royce cars, and Henry Cole tries his hand at driving a tractor as they continue their money-making tour.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team tackle a badly water-damaged rosewood table, give a much-loved panda bear a makeover and restore a vintage toy steamboat.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a toy fire engine, a Japanese Imari bowl that has been smashed to bits, and a unique village sign from Dorset.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard explores an Aladdin's cave of magic carpets in Cumbria and royal biographer Colin Campbell reveals antiques with tragic history from her romantic castle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard buy quirky items in Dorset. Twin sisters show their late father's legacy - vintage cars and steam train memorabilia. Plus, a visit to Luton's oldest hat makers.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne asks a custom coachbuilder to design a one-off hot rod. Meanwhile, Wayne readies the oldest existing DuPont vehicle for the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The team's morning banter is interrupted by a retired Airbus A320 arriving from Estonia. Plus, an unusual request comes in from a diving instructor for a highly durable item.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John take a road trip in Hungary. In Budapest, they visit one of the country's biggest antique markets. Later, they unearth treasures in a former communist factory.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard hits the Giant Shepton Flea Market, where he unearths some retro design classics. Plus, in Devon, he visits Europe's largest repository of vintage fairground rides.objects.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore two teddy bears that share a love story, a Victorian lamppost on its last legs, and a toy car powered by steam.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether the Roswell UFO incident was a Soviet conspiracy masterminded by Stalin, or if the story may be another cover-up.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ramy Romany investigates a mysterious underwater grave in the ancient Mayan city of Mayapan, where the buried may have been victims of human sacrifice.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Two homicides are investigated. The first concerns the murder of a 14-year-old girl in Florida, a crime that bears similarities to a murder in Indiana. The second case sees DNA evidence cause a suspect to confess.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Unspeakable crimes solved with the help of CCTV, focusing on the case of two Florida parents brutally gunned down. Investigators had to rely on surveillance cameras to catch the killers and bring them to justice.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of a family of five in Beason, Illinois, in September 2009. Armed robber Chris Harris was later convicted of killing Rick and Ruth Gee and three of their children.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A case in which a masked gunman robbed a California bank and escaped after a stand-off with police. Months later, when a jeweller was robbed and kidnapped, a tip-off linked the crimes.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief Investigator Boller visits a livestock auction, where he rescues horses from slaughter by outbidding buyers from meat markets.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a dog with a growth on its leg. However, after a thorough examination he finds a second lump in its mammary glands that could prove to be more sinister.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: It's a Drag Being a Bridesmaid
programme.desc: Brandon tries to find a dress to complement a client's unique wedding party, including her drag queen 'bridesman'.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Here Comes the Bride - and Her Bride
programme.desc: Brooke has her hands full with two brides, one of whom is looking for her dream gown, while Savannah wants a traditional Southern theme.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jennifer puts her budget-conscious father in a cold sweat, while Manette is convinced a gown she already put a deposit on is the one for her.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate anxiously awaits her dog's test results. Dr Danni volunteers at a pop-up clinic, while Dr Alex has a house call check-up with a pig and her piglets.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Lewis tries to solve a mysterious condition on a dog. Plus, at Perth Zoo Dr Peter looks after an elephant and Dr Danni helps a dog with a suspected twisted stomach.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: At 400lbs Bettie Jo achieves a dream - pregnancy, but will she deliver without complications? Susan has found a new relationship, can she maintain the motivation?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman with a childhood history of abuse followed in her mother's footsteps in overeating for protection, but is now trying to lose weight to save her life.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Leah Roberts who vanished in March 2000 after leaving North Carolina to do some soul-searching on a cross-country trip. The Jeep in which she was travelling was found damaged and abandoned a week later 3,000 miles from her home, close to the Canadian border, with some of her personal possessions scattered around it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A woman disagrees with her 10-year-old daughter on what she should wear for her wedding, while another customer wants a completely different look to her sister's bridal ball gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress for a traditional Greek wedding, while a customer hopes her gown will show off how much weight she has lost - but is upset by how she looks in it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katherine and Sophie from reality series DC Cupcakes begin their search for Katherine's dream wedding dress, while Suzy and her sister seek an outfit they both love.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: The Devil Is in the Details
programme.desc: Niche wants a fashionable gown but her mother prefers the traditional look, while a bride with a specific style in mind struggles to find her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Kitchen
programme.desc: Cake Boss Buddy Valastro's wife Lisa searches for the perfect dress for their vow renewal, but she is torn between two gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tamika tries to stay within her budget on the hunt for a gown, while Ashley finds the perfect princess dress, but the price may be a little too high.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Three brides search for the perfect dress, including Elona, who has recently overcome huge obstacles, and Courtney, who brings along her mother to help.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Marjorie has enlisted her loved ones to help find a dress for her wedding in two months, while bride-to-be Lynette is at odds with her family and friends.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo provides a look at readings that have never been seen before, including a spontaneous reading at a tanning salon, and a reading with a former detective.

programme.title: How to Look Good Naked
programme.desc: Stylist Gok Wan helps friends Ames and Helen rebuild their confidence and learn to love their post-baby bodies. Will they be ready to bare all on the catwalk?.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Featuring a woman whose hoarding is threatening her marriage, and another who copes with her divorce by collecting items.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Documentary examining the crimes of Charles Starkweather, an American killer who murdered 11 people in the late 1950s during a road trip with his lover.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.desc: Ed's daughters express their concerns ahead of his surgery. Meanwhile, the family unites to support Amy on her tough road to recovery.

programme.title: The 50 Stone Man: Shocking Story
programme.desc: The story of obese man John Keitz who spent seven years in bed because his body could not support his weight, but died shortly after embarking on a weight-loss programme.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Fatal shootings, including a woman found by the side of the road and a couple who were gunned down in their car.
